dimensions.feedback: Year 1 coins recognition. Denominations 1p, 2p, 5p, 10p are age-appropriate. Values stay within 1-20 range. 5 questions with good progression from identification to addition to comparison. Topic correctly reflected in every question.
All 5 answers mathematically correct: 10p coin=10, 3x2p=6, 1+2+5+10=18, 1+2+5=8, 15p>10p so Bear costs more.

Clear numbered questions with obvious input fields. Nice progression from simple coin identification to multi-coin addition to comparison. Comparison layout (VS) is intuitive. Child immediately knows what to do.
All coin images load correctly and are recognizable. Item images (orange, bear) render properly. Good contrast and sizing. Different card background colors add visual variety.
Coins are clearly visible and countable. A 5-6 year old can identify coins and count them. Comparison items show clear price labels. The working-out boxes in Q3/Q4 help scaffold the addition.

Clean layout with progress bar at 100%. All 5 questions visible with good spacing. No cut-off content. Different colored cards (yellow, blue, white, pink, orange) add visual interest without being distracting.
All images semantically match: coin images for coin questions, item images with price tags for comparison question. Working-out sections correctly list the coin values shown.

actionPoints: Consider adding 20p or 50p coins to broaden coin recognition range for Year 1
